Many other answers mentioned that you lost connectivity to your mobile carrier and to your mobile number and there to voice and SMS plan and features, as well as to your data plan. Some answers mentioned that you can still come to WiFi. I just need to add that you can still make emergency calls (at least in gsm-based networks). That's right, regardless of whether you get your carrier's signal (it works on any gsm carrier signal, not necessarily your carrier) and regardless of whether you have an active account or it's suspended or blocked or even without a SIM card, which of our current discussion, since the original design of GSM networks back in the early 1990s, your phone can still make emergency calls. The protocol even assigned a common number anywhere on the world: 999, which is the number the UK initiated it in the 1930s.

The SIM card is what connects your phone to the mobile or cellular service provider’s network. Therefore, if the SIM card is removed, the phone will no longer be able to connect to that network. This means no ability to make phone calls or send SMS text messages and also no cellular data either. The phone will still be able to connect to a WiFi network and use the internet that way since the WiFi connection is unrelated to the wireless cellular service.

Your question: “What happens when you remove a SIM card from your phone?” You lose cellular phone service, since the phone does not have any account information anymore. You could still use WiFi for data though … but no direct voice calls, since that would require Voice over WiFi support through an operator to deliver the call to an end-destination. With WiFi, you could also use an “Over the Top” voice application in some cases - such as WhatsApp to people who also have WhatsApp installed.

Think of a SIM card as a sort of license to use their network. You remove the card and you can no longer make or receive any calls or texts under their provided network or use their network to go online. It doesn't make the phone completely useless as you can still use WIFI on smart phones to do all of the above with certain apps. Even if you don't have WIFI the phone can still technically be used if you already have apps and games that require no internet connection.
